quest.name: Live and Let Dine
journal: Kotokaze eagerly waves you down, letter in hand.

Kotokaze stops you, saying she has a letter for you. Quickly skimming through its contents, you learn that Cemi has arrived at Namai in Yanxia without incident. While she seems to be enjoying her stay there, a great portion of what she writes is dedicated to food. Perhaps it would be best if you were to depart for Namai posthaste and remind her of the purpose of her journey there─to continue her studies on oriental furniture.

While initially Cemi is unable to speak of anything but food, a stern reminder from you is all that is needed to set her back on track. Once more the two of you decide to begin searching for anyone who might be in need of help.

You come across a man by the name of Reizan, who was a chef in pre-imperial Doma. As the Garleans' grip on the lands weaken, he is looking to fulfill his lifelong dream of opening a restaurant. With limited funds, however, it has been difficult for him to acquire the furniture he needs. Cemi jumps at the chance to volunteer, adding that she would like to turn this into a competition between you and her to see who can better satisfy the client. Reizan does not oppose the idea, and requests that you make something to accommodate the dining habits of both enclave and country folk. To determine exactly what that might be, he suggests you speak with the local residents.

Upon speaking with the nearby citizens, you learn that people from the enclave will only dine in a private setting, as they consider it rude to do so before strangers. This information should help you to decide on a suitable item to craft for Reizan. Perhaps now would be a good time to seek out Cemi that you might discuss ideas with her and receive the necessary materials.

Upon hearing that you intend to craft partitions, Cemi begins hurling accusations at you, convinced that you would never deign to create anything that simple unless you were attempting to lose on purpose. A simple explanation quickly calms her, and she apologizes. Handing you the materials you may need, she leaves you to make high-quality ornate partitions for Reizan.

※In the event you lose the materials or the synthesis ends in failure, you may try again by speaking with Cemi.

Just as your client is about to decide on a winner, Timbermaster Beatin swoops in and begins offering his expert opinion. Though he declares that both are finely crafted, he refrains from further comment. All of you then turn your attention to Reizan. The chef declares that from the first moment, he knew your creation was the one he preferred, as it fulfills his request for something that would allow both enclave and country folk to dine in comfort. The competition now over, Beatin bids both you and Cemi return to Gridania.

Over the course of her studies in the Far East, Cemi has come to realize the importance of listening to her clients and adapting her furniture to suit their wants and needs. Having this most important of lessons firmly instilled within her, Timbermaster Beatin is confident that she will become a better carpenter for it. He thanks you for inspiring his young apprentice and asks you to speak with her one last time before you leave.

Cemi excitedly tells you that the timbermaster has deemed her worthy of taking on clients. While fulfilling commissions, she also plans to continue practicing making oriental furniture so as not to forget all that she learned during her stay in the Far East. It seems she looks up to you a great deal and hopes that she will one day become a master carpenter like you.

※The next carpenter quest will be available from Cemi upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Cemi Jinjahl in Namai.
Speak with the residents of Namai.
Synthesize an ornate partition Deliver the ornate partition to Reizan.
Return to the Carpenters' Guild in Gridania.

dialogue.name: KOTOKAZE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! A letter from Cemi has just arrived for you.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHLLATTER
dialogue.text:
(-Letter from Cemi-)Dear Forename,
I am writing to tell you that I have arrived in a tiny village in Yanxia known as Namai.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHLLATTER
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Cemi-)It's such a delightful place. Every day I stumble across something new─whether it be the unusual materials they employ in their construction or the unfamiliar but delicious foods.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHLLATTER
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Cemi-)Oh, yes, the food here is exquisite, and their desserts are even better. In fact, the sugar-coated dumplings they have are simply to die for!

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHLLATTER
dialogue.text:
(-Letter from Cemi-)I'll be sure to treat you to some when you come. See you soon.
Yours truly,
Cemi

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Forename! How wonderful it is to see you. It's been far too long.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Have you tried any of the local cuisine yet? If you haven't, I know the perfect place for us to start.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I-I was planning to take you there purely to discuss business, I swear! After all, where better to do that than over food?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Gah!

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: All right, all right! Your disapproval has been duly noted. Instead of going for food, let us search out any people who might be in need of our assistance, then.

dialogue.name: KOTOKAZE
dialogue.text: Ah, the Culinarians' Guild must be extremely proud to have a member as passionate about food as Cemi. She is sure to make a fine chef one day.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Help? Yes, I could use some of that.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: You see, in the days before the Empire held dominion over our lands, I was a chef. While our freedom from them is fleeting, I would nevertheless like to use this opportunity to once again pursue my passion for cooking. As such, I have been thinking to open up my own restaurant.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: You see, in the days before the Empire held dominion over our lands, I was a chef. I hold out hope that one day, when the imperial forces are driven from our country, I will be free to pursue my passion, once more. When that time comes, I wish to start up my own restaurant.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: To do so, I would need to procure basic furnishings for my future shop. It is not a simple task. Most of what I have come across is either far too expensive or of poor quality.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Then you may be pleased to hear, sir, that before you stand two highly skilled members of the Carpenters' Guild in Gridania. We shall see that you receive the furniture you require.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: You would do this for me?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Most certainly. What kind of furnishings do you need?

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Apart from tables and chairs, I need something that would allow my guests to feel at ease. Those from the enclave have different dining habits to those of us here in Namai. I would like to create an environment where both would feel equally welcome.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Please, leave it to us, sir. Now, Forename, what do you say to making things a tad more interesting? Let's turn this into a competition.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: We will each make something for our client and present the finished product to him. He will then judge them and decide on a winner.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Pretty, pretty please─won't you do it for me? This is the only way I can show Timbermaster Beatin I'm just as skilled as all the other carpenters in the guild.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Haha! It's settled then!

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Go about making the furniture however you will, but I recommend you speak with the people here before getting started. Some have lived here their entire lives, others once lived in the enclave. With their help you may better understand the subtle differences in our ways.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir, we'll be sure to do that. Forename, once you've decided what you'll be making, come and find me. I'll furnish you with any materials you might need.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Hello? Is there anyone out there seeking the services of a young carpenter? Anyone at all?

dialogue.name: INAGARA
dialogue.text: I would say that the people from the enclave are more elegant than us─never seen one with a hair out of place or in clothes that have not been neatly pressed. They place great importance on rules, manners, and fashion over there.

dialogue.name: MANAZURU
dialogue.text: Yes. I suppose you could say I am from the enclave, though I have lived here for most of my life. When I was young, my family and I fled to this village that we might escape imperial troops.

dialogue.name: MANAZURU
dialogue.text: Wh-What? You would like for me to demonstrate the difference in dining habits!?

dialogue.name: MANAZURU
dialogue.text: Hmph. I am afraid that is not something I can help you with.

dialogue.name: MIYAKE
dialogue.text: The only difference is that table manners are practically nonexistent out here. The people have good hearts, but they have no sense of etiquette. They will eat their food on the streets and sip their tea in front of you!

dialogue.name: MIYAKE
dialogue.text: One should take their meals behind closed doors with family or friends. <sigh> It would be nice if they would at least eat behind a partition of some sort and spare the rest of us the sight...

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Your friend─she is full to the brim with energy.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Forename, remember to come and pick up your materials from me once you've decided on what you're going to make.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Have you finally decided on what you'll be making?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: I'll be building the entire restaurant from the ground up!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: A wooden shield to protect the food from, well, you know...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Ornate partitions that can be hung between each of the tables.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Have you lost your mind? You're an amazing carpenter, but even you wouldn't be able to manage such a feat in so little time.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Protect the food from what exactly? That doesn't sound like a place anyone would feel comfortable to dine at...

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...Partitions? But that seems so...dull. That's not what you're really thinking to make is it?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...Wait! You're not trying to lose on purpose, are you?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: While I know I'm not yet as good as you, never did I think that you saw me as so far beneath you that you would feel the need to do this...

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: My apologies. It seems I jumped to conclusions again. I know you're not the type of person to do something like that.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: It's no excuse, but lately I've been on edge. I can't shake the feeling this is my last chance to convince Timbermaster Beatin that I am a capable carpenter, worthy of being called as such. If I don't, he might stop assigning me work, and I may as well leave the guild.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I shall not let it come to that! No matter what it takes, I must find a way prove myself.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Oh, I completely forgot! I'm terribly sorry. I didn't mean to blabber on about my worries. After all, you're here for materials, aren't you?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Here you are. Feel free to come back if it's not enough.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Is your friend always so...excitable?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: You misplaced the materials I gave you? <sigh>

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I guess one of the many perks of being a master carpenter is that you need not be subjected to long lectures when you lose things...

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Well, here you are. Now I really must return to my work, so please do take care not to misplace your materials again.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Please, take your partitions to Reizan. I'll also make my way to him shortly.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Hm? What have we here?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Ahem. May I...

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Timbermaster Beatin!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: This table is exquisite. It is extremely sturdy, yet manages to maintain a sleek elegance. ...And these Doman-style engravings that run up and down the sides of the legs─if I did not know better I would guess they were the work of a more practiced pair of hands than your own, Cemi.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Now, Forename, let us see yours. Ah... Simple but all the more stunning for it. The lacquer finish is a nice touch─a light gloss that is just enough to enhance the natural blush of the wood, but not overpower it.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: While both of these are masterpieces in their own right, I will say this: the detailed engravings on the table are something even a highly skilled artisan would struggle to recreate.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: What do you think, sir?

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: The moment I saw it, I knew which one of these I wanted─desperately needed, even. I choose...

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: This one!

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: That Forename is a better carpenter than me, I won't deny. That shehe has skills I could only ever dream of attaining, I'll also admit... But I...I poured my heart and soul into that table!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Sir, why is it that you chose Forename's partitions over Cemi's table?

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Simple, really. Doman city folk are a private sort. They would appreciate the way these wooden barriers would hide them from sight as they eat.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: The young lady's table is magnificent─a work of art, even. However, it does not fulfill the needs of my customers like these partitions do.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: It seems the time it took to carve the intricate detailing on this table would have been better spent interviewing the local citizens.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Cemi, do you understand now why it is you lost? You were so focused on demonstrating your own skill that you disregarded the needs of the client.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Forename, on the other hand, spoke with the residents of this village, which inspired herhim to create these partitions─a product that places the customer's needs above all else.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: In that sense, the difference between your table and herhis partitions is the difference between a decent carpenter and a master of the craft.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: That said, this is where your journey ends. I expect to see the both of you back in Gridania shortly after I return.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: No... No, it can't be. Please tell me Timbermaster Beatin hasn't given up on me. Oh, what am I to do?

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Is your friend all right? While I cannot claim to understand what any of that was about, I would like to thank you for your wonderful contribution. It is sure to suit my restaurant perfectly.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: You've finished? Already? Well, what are you waiting for─take it to Reizan. I'll join the two of you shortly.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Opening up a restaurant has always been a dream of mine. To think that it might soon be within my grasp fills me with joy beyond belief.

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERA02444
dialogue.text: Timbermaster Beatin, thank the Matron you've returned! The drawers of this desk you made for me are broken. Is there a chance they can be fixed?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I shall see what can be done. After all, I can hardly say no to someone who has so cherished one of my creations as you have.

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERB02444
dialogue.text: Timbermaster Beatin, sir. My son─he's just been accepted into the Order of the Twin Adder. To celebrate, I'd like to have you craft him a fine spear.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Order of the Twin Adder... That is quite the accomplishment. Very well. I shall make him a one that will see him through all his battles.

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERC02444
dialogue.text: Wait, sir! Come back! <sigh> I also had a request for him, but I suppose it'll have to wait. I should have known getting the finest carpenter in all of Gridania to make something for you wasn't going to be an easy task.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Excuse me. Um... If you don't mind my asking, why is it that all of you like Timbermaster Beatin so much?

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERC02444
dialogue.text: When you ask him to make something, he creates that item for you and you alone.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: To make something for that person and that person alone... Thinking back, that's how I first got into carpentry.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I was born into a family poorer than dirt─one where we couldn't afford to purchase even the most basic of furniture.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: My mother raised us by herself, working from dawn until dusk so that my sisters and I wouldn't go to bed hungry every night. As a result, she pushed herself too hard and one day, the pain in her back became too much to bear.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Seeing her suffering drove me to make her an armchair in which she could rest from time to time. It was all the young me could think to do.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: While the finished product creaked and buckled under her weight, not for a single moment as I was making it did I lose sight of the fact that I was doing it all for her.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: I've been so preoccupied with myself─with trying to prove my skills─that somewhere along the way I forgot the most important thing...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: It is never too late to remember and begin anew...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Cemi, the key to harnessing your own potential is to recognize what is holding you back. From here, you can only grow.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: ...Yes. Yes, sir! You're absolutely right. There is still hope for me.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Forename, thank you for supporting me until now. It is only because of you that I have come this far.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: In fact, I'd go so far as to say that our grand adventures together have made me feel as though I've been born again. I am looking forward to exploring the world of carpentry once more!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: She is not the only one who owes you a debt of gratitude. While I am skilled at working with wood, I am not nearly so adept at dealing with people and their problems. You have helped Cemi in ways I could not.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: You are part of the reason I have such high hopes for the girl. With a mentor like you to look up to, she will no doubt flourish. That is why I ask that you speak with her one last time before you leave.

dialogue.name: REIZAN
dialogue.text: Thank you for all your help. If you ever come back for a visit, do be sure to stop by my new restaurant.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: Forename, you'll be happy to hear that Timbermaster Beatin has finally deemed my work good enough to begin taking on some of my own clients! Isn't it so exciting?

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: That's not to say I'll forget about my studies or the guild's troubles, however. In between commissions, I'll be spending my time practicing how to make oriental furniture. That way, I can retain all that I learned from our trips to Kugane and Namai.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: But that's not all. I'll be keeping the people we met there in mind. They'll help me to remember that I am making this furniture not for myself, but for those around me.

dialogue.name: CEMIJINJAHL
dialogue.text: You'll see, Forename. I'm going to work so hard that one day, I'll be as good as you.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Cemi has stumbled across the secret to becoming a true craftsman. While she may be but a seed now, it shall not be long until she begins to bud. I look forward to seeing just how she blossoms.
